alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:09PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 408 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Wheatland Reservoir 3 to 16 miles north of Iron Mountain. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Iron Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
